page.title: 04Newport Public Houses
page.content:
In the 18th centrury there were about 60{Public Houses}in Newport.Travellers from Liverpool to London on the busy A41 stopped overnight in the town.This promoted a great deal of trade in this large number of {Public Houses}.Many of the{Public Houses}being{Coaching {Houses}.Today there are 13{Public {Houses}.One of these{Coaching Houses} ,The Barly Mow, remains in use today. The large double doors through which horses and carriages once passed are now used by delivery men as a entrance for barrels to the cellar.Apart from a {Public Houses}and restaurant, part of the building is hired out for wedding receptions and to the local Karate clubs.Todays prices are in 1985:- Bitter 62p -pt,Mild 60p- pt,Larger 65p pt,Wisky 56p 16 to the Gill.
{ }
